author: COMSOL
description: The Hubble Space Telescope (HST) is an example of a standard Cassegrain telescope. The ‘Conic Mirror On Axis 3D’ part from the Ray Optics Module Part Library is used to construct the HST Ritchey–Chrétien geometry. Multiple release features are used to generate on- and off-axis ray and spot diagrams.
label: hubble_space_telescope.mph
name: root

settings.description: Primary mirror number of azimuthal extra points
settings.name: np_extra

settings.description: Secondary mirror z position (relative to primary vertex)
settings.name: Z_sec

settings.description: Image surface back focal length (relative to primary vertex)
settings.name: Z_bfl

settings.description: Image surface z position (relative to secondary vertex)
settings.name: Z_image

settings.description: Exit pupil z position (relative to image surface)
settings.name: Z_exit

settings.description: Ratio of back focal length to primary focal length
settings.name: beta
commentsinfile
settings.value:
Conic Mirror On Axis 3D

On axis conic mirror. The mirror surface may be either concave or convex. A central hole may or may not be present. A clear aperture which is smaller than the mirror surface diameter can be specified.

settings.name: commentsinfile
settings.value:
Circular Planar Annulus

Circular planar annulus with negligible thickness.

settings.value: Hexapolar grid contains a total of 331 grid points.

settings.value: Conical distribution contains a total of 331 directions.
